snippet: Walmart’s domestic sales were flat instead of falling, Penney’s sharply cut its losses, and Kohl’s sales and profit fell. Macy’s gave a forecast that will hinge on customer sentiment.
abstract: Walmart reports second-quarter diluted earnings of $1.21 per share, relatively flat from year-ago period; revenue increased 2.8 percent from 2013, to $119.3 billion; J C Penney says its net loss narrowed 71 percent to $172 million during quarter, far less than $586 million loss in 2013 second quarter; company reports suggest that shoppers are still wary.
lead_paragraph: Walmart’s domestic sales were flat instead of falling, Penney’s sharply cut its losses, and Kohl’s sales and profit fell. Macy’s gave a forecast that will hinge on customer sentiment.

headline.main: Walmart, J.C. Penney and Other Retailers See a Tentative Shopper
headline.print_headline: Major Retailers See a Tentative U.S. Shopper
